title: ALARM FILTER CONFIGURATION COMMAND
description: This command allows the operator to configure Alarm filter parameters.
user_level:
The command can be accessed by operators with alarm privileges, and executed by 
operators with alarm privileges.
syntax: > configure alarm filter (fltr-type) filterid <Alarm::fltrId> [ alarmid <Alarm::alarmIndexExt> ] [ no status | status <Alarm::fltrStatus> ] [ no threshold | threshold <Alarm::fltrThreshold> ] [ no window | window <Alarm::fltrWindow> ]

resource_parameters.name: (fltr-type)
resource_parameters.description: the type of the considered alarm filter

command_parameters.name: alarmid

command_parameters.name: [no] status
command_parameters.description: filter status optional parameter with default value: "not-used"
values: not-used              : deactivate the configured alarm filter
used                  : activate the configured alarm filter

command_parameters.name: [no] threshold
command_parameters.description: the threshold value of the considered alarm filter optional parameter with default value: "2" - the threshold value of the considered alarm filter - range: [2...65535]

command_parameters.name: [no] window
command_parameters.description: the duration of the filter window, only applicable for temporal type optional parameter with default value: "60" - the duration of the filter window in seconds - range: [1...65535]

raw:
help configure alarm filter
ALARM FILTER CONFIGURATION COMMAND
==================================

Command Description
-------------------

This command allows the operator to configure Alarm filter parameters.


User Level
----------

The command can be accessed by operators with alarm privileges, and executed by 
operators with alarm privileges.

Command Syntax
--------------

The command has the following syntax:
> configure alarm filter (fltr-type) filterid <Alarm::fltrId> [ alarmid 
<Alarm::alarmIndexExt> ] [ no status | status <Alarm::fltrStatus> ] [ no 
threshold | threshold <Alarm::fltrThreshold> ] [ no window | window 
<Alarm::fltrWindow> ]

Command Parameters
------------------

Table "Alarm Filter Configuration Command" Resource Parameters

Resource Identifier        Description

(fltr-type)                the type of the considered alarm filter
filterid                   unique filter number
